Generation V.Black: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
Generation V.White: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
Generation V.Black 2: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
Generation V.White 2: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

Generation VI.X: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
Generation VI.Y: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.

Generation VIII.Sword: As halfhearted as this Pokémon's kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr's concrete pillars.
Generation VIII.Shield: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.

Generation V.Black 2: Routes 15 and 18 , P2 Laboratory Route 1 ( dark grass )
Generation V.White 2: Routes 15 and 18 , P2 Laboratory Route 1 ( dark grass )
